text: Lynchburg is an independent city in the U.S. state of Virginia. It is in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains along the banks of the James River. Lynchburg is known as the "City of Seven Hills" and "The Hill City". It is sometimes called "A City Unto Itself" because of the city's historical avoidance of State and Federal entanglements. At the 2020 census, 79,009 people lived in Lynchburg. ==References== Category:Cities in Virginia
title: Lynchburg, Virginia
